results.title: Following their footsteps
results.brief_description: The small towns of Kernot and Grantville in south-eastern Victoria, depend on volunteer emergency services to ensure that when fires break out, car accidents happen or cats are stuck in trees, that someone is there to help. Who better to have on call than local legend Barrie Stewart and the dedicated members of the Kernot/Grantville CFA.

results.title: Nanneella Primary School
results.creator_credit: Jason White, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This small rural Primary School of 26 students is at the heart of Nanneella and its residents. With a motto of ‘A School and Community Together’ the Primary School is an integral part of all town events and social gatherings. The students are engaging and fun young individuals with clear ideas and hopes for the future. This film also features a performance from ‘Power Wars’, a musical piece that incorporates science and drama and won Nanneella Primary School the 2009 Archimedes Award.

results.title: My Colbo
results.brief_description: This film takes us on a tour of Colbinabbin and surrounds from the point of view of a number of locals. From the Old Cellar and Community Well to Chinaman’s Bend and Marian’s old family home that is covered in writings from the past, this story is full of historical facts and current realities. It also includes the story of the short-lived but successful Colbinabbin Tractor Pull and the once vibrant Lake Cooper which is now dry and has been for some years.

results.title: Life in the waves: a story about Island Surfboards
results.brief_description:
Sandy Ryan’s life revolves around surfing, helping his dad run ‘Island Surfboards’ on Phillip Island in south-eastern Victoria, and teaching others how to ride waves. Matt’s best mate and mentor, Glyndyn, is an ex-pro surfer that shapes boards for ‘Island Surfboards’ and doesn’t mind a surf either.
This is a story about a mateship, keeping it local and living the surfing lifestyle dream.

results.title: Ladies of Lockington
results.creator_credit: Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the ladies who are at the heart of Lockington. These passionate and committed women get things done. They network, coordinate, manage and harness the talent that is available to them to improve and enhance the quality of life for all the families of Lockington and surrounding districts.

results.title: Contentment
results.creator_credit: Noel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A shearer for thirty years, Noel Atkinson’s life was turned upside down when he discovered he had Parkinson’s Disease. His new found passion in art and woodwork however has enabled him to live with this debilitating disease and provide comfort and strength in his everyday life.

results.title: An Interview with Warwick N. Johanson
results.brief_description: After joining the Navy when he turned 17, one of the first lessons Warwick Johanson learnt was that if anything moved, you saluted it, if it stood still, you polished it. His home for over four years was aboard the flagship, the HMAS Australia, often a target for the formidable Japanese Kamakaze. Warwick also reflects on World War II and what it was like in Australia, when the country was actually in peril, almost unimaginable in this day and age.

results.title: The Gervasoni Family Estate: life in the Yandoit houses
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Maurie Gervasoni’s grandfather settled in Newstead during the Victorian gold rush in the 1860’s and quickly designed and built a family estate. A love of music and dancing made the Yandoit houses a destination for vibrant country living. The stone house and former stables presently sit as a relic, but Maurie hopes that one day the place will be restored to its former glory.
results.title_for_label: The Gervasoni Family Estate: life in the Yandoit houses

results.title: Theatre Royal: Castlemaine
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: A Castlemaine icon, the Theatre Royal is one of the oldest theatres in the country dating back to 1858. The owner in 2010, the projectionist, a burlesque performer and a local regular patron talk about their cinematic experiences, the history of the building, its architectural delights and how it is a major social centre for the town. Changing with the times, this is not only a single screen cinema, it offers music nights, community events, artist markets and even boasts a theatre ghost.

results.title: Game Masters: Warren Spector interview
results.creator_credit: Dean Robb, ACMI Content Development, ACMI Media Studio and ACMI
results.brief_description:
In this interview, featured as part of the ‘Game Masters’ exhibition, Warren Spector speaks about his career as a videogame designer. Warren refers to his days of playing ‘Dungeons and Dragons’ and the influence this has had on him as a vidoegames designer. A great collector of board games and Disney memorabilia, Warren talks with great passion about the importance of archiving and making games a medium worth recognising.

Warren Spector is a master of role playing game design and has been influenced and inspired by films and literature, such as ‘Blade Runner’ and cyberpunk science fiction, he is best known for creating influential titles such as ‘Deus Ex’ and his most recent release, ‘Disney Epic Mickey’.

NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

Warren Spector is a master of role playing game design and has been influenced and inspired by films and literature, such as ‘Blade Runner’ and cyberpunk science fiction, he is best known for creating influential titles such as ‘Deus Ex’ and his most recent release, ‘Disney Epic Mickey’.
